references.paper_title: A modern look at the relationship between sharpness and generalization
references.reason: This paper challenges the prevailing belief that flatness of adversarial examples is directly correlated with improved transferability, providing a crucial theoretical foundation for the current work.

references.paper_title: Sharp minima can generalize for deep nets
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of sharp minima in deep learning, a crucial concept for understanding the relationship between flatness and generalization which is relevant to adversarial transferability.

references.paper_title: Sharpness-aware minimization for efficiently improving generalization
references.reason: This paper introduces Sharpness-Aware Minimization (SAM), a technique used to improve generalization, which is analogous to improving transferability in adversarial examples and is directly related to the current work.
This paper introduces the momentum-based attack, which is a foundational adversarial attack method; the current work builds upon the concept of transferability.

references.paper_title: Evading defenses to transferable adversarial examples by translation-invariant attacks
references.reason: This paper explores the concept of transferable adversarial examples and introduces techniques to enhance their transferability; this is highly relevant to the main focus of the current study.
